alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk; Northern Nassau; Northwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued September 28 at 4:02PM EDT until September 30 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Northwest Suffolk, Northeast Suffolk and Northern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...From 10 PM EDT this evening through late Friday night. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Brief minor flooding of the more vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 2 to 3 ft on the north shore of Long Island, and 3 to 5 ft at Orient Point will result in beach erosion and flooding and possible localized dune erosion. Splashover bulkheads and dune structures may locally exacerbate flooding for shoreline roads and properties. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Minor flooding may also be possible around the time of high tide Saturday morning. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. FLAX POND AT OLD FIELD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 9.2 FT, MODERATE 10.2 FT, MAJOR 12.2 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.9 FT, MODERATE 2.9 FT, MAJOR 4.9 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 28/11 PM 8.8/ 9.3 1.5/ 2.0 0.7/ 1.1 2 NONE 29/12 PM 9.2/ 9.7 1.9/ 2.3 0.8/ 1.3 2 MINOR 30/12 AM 8.8/ 9.3 1.5/ 2.0 0.8/ 1.3 2 NONE 30/12 PM 9.1/ 9.6 1.8/ 2.2 0.6/ 1.1 1 MINOR 01/01 AM 8.3/ 8.8 1.0/ 1.5 0.5/ 1.0 1 NONE 01/01 PM 9.0/ 9.5 1.7/ 2.2 0.5/ 1.0 1 NONE PECONIC RIVER AT RIVERHEAD NY MLLW CATEGORIES -
